Pite»ôti

Este cunoscut faptul cƒÉ programatorii transformƒÉ cafeaua √Æn cod, dar este varƒÉ »ôi o limonadƒÉ cu ghea»õƒÉ »ôi mentƒÉ face minuni.

A»ôadar vƒÉ invitƒÉm la o √Ænt√¢lnire informalƒÉ, ‚ÄùCode, Coffee and Lemonade‚Äù marca GDG Pite»ôti, Joi, 11 august, ora 19:00 la Zeta Terrace & Lounge situat la etajul 2, din Trivale Shopping Center.

Pentru a organiza lucrurile »ôi pentru cƒÉ locurile sunt limitate vƒÉ rugƒÉm sƒÉ completa»õi acest formular: https://goo.gl/forms/bseboVbU8shgZXgF2

Do you want to meet other Google developers like you? Are you looking to get a chance to work on some of your own code? Do you want to share your ideas for our next meetups?

Then come join us for ‚ÄúCode, Coffee and Lemonade‚Äù, an informal afternoon get-together outside of the regular GDG Pitesti meetings to give you a chance to get to know each other better and end the day on the right foot! There is no agenda for ‚ÄúCode, Coffee and Lemonade‚Äù so feel free to pop in, even just for a few minutes, just to say hello, or plan to stay a while longer if you'd like. Just bring yourself and enjoy!

GDG Pite»ôti offers the lemonade! ;)

events.name: Boost your digital knowledge
events.description:
Boost your digital knowledge

Atelierul Digital in Romania provides free digital skills training for students, employers and business owners through an online platform, as well as face-to-face trainings in different cities across the country.

You should invest several hours, September 16th, in order to get an intro to various things like how to build, optimise and promote a website, SEO, SEM, social media, email marketing, web analytics and much more.

events.name: Firebase Christmas Codelab
events.description:
In summer we received feedback from the GDG Pitesti community members and on the list of the next topics to cover on our events was Firebase.

So GDG Pitesti will close the year with an awesome Firebase Christmas Lab. This codelab is designed to help the community developers learn about using Firebase.

And because this meetup is near Christmas, and Christmas is a time when family and friends come together and remember the good things they have, we will sing carols and we will spread some joy! :)

AGENDA

‚û°Ô∏è¬†"Firebase Web Codelab" facilitated by Alin Miu and Magda Miu

Register here!¬†

events.name: Kotlin Night Pitesti
events.description:
Kotlin is a statically typed programming language¬†for modern multiplatform applications.¬†100% interoperable with Java‚Ñ¢ and Android‚Ñ¢ and now it's official on Android.¬†

At Google I/O 2017, the Android team announced first-class support for Kotlin.¬†

For Android developers, Kotlin support is a chance to use a modern and powerful language, helping solve common headaches such as runtime exceptions and source code verbosity. Kotlin is easy to get started with and can be gradually introduced into existing projects, which means that your existing skills and technology investments are preserved.

Starting now, Android Studio 3.0 ships with Kotlin out of the box, meaning Android developers no longer need to install any extras or worry about compatibility. It also means that moving forward, you can rest assured that both JetBrains and Google will be supporting Android development in Kotlin.

At Kotlin Night Pitesti we will learn about the capabilities of the Kotlin language.

The agenda:

1. Intro to Kotlin

2. What is fun in Kotlin?

The speakers are Magda Miu and Alin Miu.

It will be a fun experience and we will have also swags offered by our sponsor for this event:¬†JetBrains.¬†

Register here for free:¬†https://goo.gl/forms/cs0pkYFuKMcs5bUn1

See you at the event! :)

events.name: Firebase Meetup with a Googler
events.description:
Join us to learn how Firebase helps mobile app teams of all sizes across the entire development lifecycle, from building your app, to improving app quality, to growing your business. You‚Äôll also get the opportunity to ask questions and give feedback directly to a team member from Google that builds Firebase.

üìí AGENDA:
‚úÖ 19:00 - 19:05 Opening from the community organisers
‚úÖ 19:05 - 19:35 Magda Miu | Android Technical Lead at Roweb | Using Java to interact with Firebase in Android
‚úÖ 19:35 - 20:20 Jon Mensing | Product Manager at Google | Running and Growing live apps with Firebase
‚úÖ 20:20 - 21:00 Networking

üë®üèª‚Äçüíª Jon Mensing

üìåPresentation title:
Running and Growing live apps with Firebase

üìÉ Abstract:
You may be familiar with Firebase as a realtime database in the Cloud, but it's much, much more. In this session we'll discuss how Firebase can be used to improve your live app's quality, manage feature rollouts, perform A/B tests, send notifications, and more.

üöÄBio:
Jon Mensing is a Product Manager at Google who focuses on messaging and testing features within Firebase. His past experience includes work at BuzzFeed and Zynga. Jon has an MBA from Wharton, a Master of Public Policy degree from the Harvard Kennedy School, and a B.S. in Computer Science from the U.S. Air Force Academy.

üë®üèª‚Äçüíª Magda Miu

üìåPresentation title:
Using Java to interact with Firebase in Android

üìÉ Abstract:
Firebase is a platform used to build better apps, improve their quality and also to grow businesses.
This talk will cover examples about how to create a new project in Firebase console, how to integrate Google sign-in in the Java code in Android, how to save and get data from Cloud Firestore and how to use Cloud Messaging. Finally we will review the advantages of using Firebase Crashlytics that help us, the developers, to never miss a critical crash.

üöÄBio:
Magda is an enthusiastic and innovative Mobile Team Leader and Certified Scrum Master with more than 7 years experience in software development. She is also co-organiser at Google Developers Group Pitesti and Women Techmakers Romania.

P.S.: only 70 seats available
events.how_to_find_us: Strada Ion Constantin Bratianu 48-52, Pite»ôti 110110, Romania (Centru Afaceri Pitesti)

events.name: IWD 2019 by Women Techmakers Romania & GDG Pitesti
events.description:
International Women's Day (IWD) is marked on March 8th every year. In different regions, the focus of celebrations ranges from general respect and appreciation toward women to a celebration of women's economic, political, and social achievements.

AGENDA:
19:00 - 19:05 | Intro about WTM Romania
19:05 - 19:35 | "Let‚Äôs talk Product", Raluca Pantiru
19:35 - 19:45 | "Know your persona and the rest will follow", Anca Sandu
19:45 - 20:15 | "Innovation Labs - the backstage story", Flavia Husar

üë©‚Äçüíª Raluca Pantiru, Product Manager @ Fitbit

üìÉ Bio:
Raluca is a product person, passionate about wellness and innovative products, with a fondness for direct interaction with users.
At Fitbit, she has been involved in long-term strategy, execution, launch and product direction for new markets and segments, for both software and hardware products.
Raluca and her team launched Fitbit Ace, Fitbit's first activity tracker for kids, as well as the Family Account, a feature within the Fitbit app, that allows the whole family to support each other on their health journey.
Raluca started off her career in the Consumer Products Industry back in 2016, in Marketing, when she joined Vector Watch, the Romanian startup that created the ‚Äúaffordable luxury‚Äù smartwatch with a 30-day battery life. Vector Watch was acquired by Fitbit the same year.
Previous to Vector Watch, she worked as a law consultant.
Raluca loves flat whites and airports.

üë©‚Äçüíª Anca Sandu, Product Manager

üìÉ Bio:
Anca chose to leave the corporate life after 8 years of online market research in IPSOS and another 5 of marketing & comms in IBM. Currently, she's crafting a product for eCommerce in Omniconvert. She finds it difficult to define her current role but some people named her an intrapreneur, so we will go with that. When she's not at work, she likes to get involved in innovation projects and use Design Thinking methodology. She's the happiest puppy on this planet when she gets the chance to talk to people. So user research is her thing. On Sundays, you will find her in Ferentari doing homework with the kids from School no 136.

üë©‚Äçüíª Flavia Husar, Communication and Brand manager @ Innovation Labs

üìÉ Bio:
Responsible for overseeing and coordinating all communication with media, social and community stakeholders. As the CCO she managea the communication and brand strategy, all Innovation Labs official communications and also the social media channels. Also, she supervises new initiatives and plans for the Innovation Labs community and the creation and distribution of all promotion materials, visuals and marketing campaigns that include the Tech Lounge and Innovation Labs brand. Also, she coordinates all events' organising together with the executive team and partners of the program.

***Important Information: By registering you agree to appear in photographic and video material taken at the event and you allow the organizers of Women Techmakers to use this material for future promotional purposes.
